data.content:
noun
plural ~ holds
[count] chiefly US
a method of holding someone by putting your arm around the person's neck with enough pressure to make breathing difficult or impossible
He put the suspect in a choke hold. = He used/placed a choke hold on the suspect.
a force or influence that stops something from growing or developing :stranglehold
usually singular
The state has a choke hold on the city's finances.
The tariffs have put a choke hold on the economy.
